image.altText: A woman in a pale pink jacket walks down a glass-walled corridor.

props.synopsis: The decision brings the party closer to the Nationals, which ditched its support for the target earlier this month amid internal turmoil over the Coalition's policy.

title.children: Liberal Party formally abandons net zero by 2050 climate target

image.altText: Pedestrians cross at Flinders Street

props.synopsis: The unemployment rate fell to 4.3 per cent in October, down from 4.5 per cent in September, as the number of people in employment increased by 42,200.

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate slips to 4.3 per cent

image.altText: A man in a blue suit stands in front of a blurry background

props.synopsis: The US House of Representatives has voted to reopen the federal government after the longest shutdown in history.

title.children: US House passes bill to end historic government shutdown

image.altText: A couple of dozen Aboriginal Victorians pictured with arms raised in celebration

props.synopsis: Victoria's first treaty with Aboriginal people has been signed by members of the Aboriginal community, the premier and state governor.

title.children: Australia's first treaty with Aboriginal people becomes law in Victoria

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell has been released from prison, two months after a magistrate ruled he was too dangerous to live in the community and could interfere with witnesses in a criminal case.

title.children: Breaking: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell released from prison

image.altText: Donald Trump places a hand on his chest.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein is pushed back into the spotlight after a congressional committee unearths years-old emails in which the convicted sex trafficker refers to Mr Trump as "the dog that hasn't barked".

title.children: What's in the Epstein emails that say Trump 'spent hours at my house' with trafficking victim?

image.altText: A 70-year-old woman with shoulder length brown hair sitting down.

props.synopsis: The then-16-year-old stabbed the Queensland grandmother at a shopping centre in February last year as her granddaughter watched on.

title.children: Teen sentenced to 16 years for murder of grandmother Vyleen White

image.altText: Person in a green jumper fills a glass full of water from a kitchen tap.

props.synopsis: Councils are voting to remove fluoride from drinking water — so why did we add it in the first place, and how can you protect your teeth if you're losing access to it?

title.children: 'A repair tool': How fluoride in water helps strengthen teeth

image.altText: A woman walks on a path as snow falls at Mt Buffallo, Vic

props.synopsis: From heat, back to snow, fire danger and storm warnings – spring weather has given the country some serious whiplash. What's behind it?

title.children: What's behind Australia's weather whiplash

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: The local share market takes another leg lower as labour force figures pour cold water on rate cut expectations. The corporate watchdog reveals its 2026 enforcement priorities, vowing to protect consumers from financial harm. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX tumbles as stronger jobs figures quash rate cut prospects

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Most young Australians struggle with financial security, new Monash research says
'Still some concerns' about jobs market, despite decline in unemployment
Liberals formally agree to dump net zero by 2050

image.altText: A Menulog food delivery bag with pies in plastic.

props.synopsis: The food delivery company is set to shut down on November 26. Here's what we know about the closure.

title.children: Menulog is closing down in Australia. Here's what we know

image.altText: A female medical specialist in an office with a female patient

props.synopsis: Some Australians are waiting more than six years to see health specialists, prompting doctors to warn that people are risking death while languishing on public waiting lists.

title.children: The 'devastating impact' of Australia's six-year wait for specialists

image.altText: A side profile of Ms Hudson, with a minuture Qantas plane tail blurred in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has entered into an agreement with Qantas for a Product Innovation Centre that is expected to create more than 420 technology jobs by the end of 2028.

title.children: Breaking: Hundreds of Qantas jobs to come to new innovation centre in Adelaide

image.altText: the remains of a large ship seen under water from above

props.synopsis: Shifting sands have re-exposed the Hereward shipwreck just metres from a swimming beach in Sydney's east.

title.children: Century-old shipwreck re-emerges at popular Sydney beach

image.altText: A small hand holding a handful of blueberries

props.synopsis: The federal pesticide authority has updated how the chemical dimethoate can be used on berries after new data confirmed skyrocketing consumption has been putting young children over the safety limit.

title.children: Insecticide on berries found to exceed safe dose for children

image.altText: Two F1 drivers standing on the grid before a race, with their team pricipal standing behind

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri says the Azerbaijan Grand Prix weekend was the worst of his racing career and has hinted McLaren team orders may have played a part in it.

title.children: McLaren orders part of 'perfect storm' that began Piastri's F1 form slump

image.altText: A man runs in a mountainous landscape.

props.synopsis: A documentary following a 20-year-old's epic 500-kilometre run over seven days is nominated for awards at six international film festivals.

title.children: Film documenting runner's gruelling trek through Blue Mountains goes global

image.altText: Prabowo and Albanese speak at a podium, both suits and "HMAS CANBERRA" hats.

props.synopsis: Details of an upgraded security treaty between Indonesia and Australia are yet to be made public, and the practical impact it will have on relations between the two countries depends on who you ask.

title.children: What will Indonesia gain from its 'good neighbours' treaty with Australia?

image.altText: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu standing with their faces very close to each other behind a podium

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has taken the extraordinary step of writing to Israel's President Isaac Herzog calling on him to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu of long-standing corruption charges.

title.children: Trump writes formal letter to ask for a pardon for Netanyahu

image.altText: Jacinta Allan appears serious, looking to the left, in a close portrait photograph.

props.synopsis: The Allan government will mirror Queensland with harsher jail sentences for children, but experts say the new legislation will not reduce youth crime.

title.children: Jacinta Allan looks north in bid to solve Victoria's youth crime crisis

image.altText: A woman in exercise guy at the nadir of a pull-up on a bar in a gym.

props.synopsis: Jade Henderson says she has been the victim of online abuse since breaking the Guinness World Record for the most pull-ups in an hour.

title.children: Gold Coast police officer's pull-up world record marred by online abuse

image.altText: A golden egg in a nest symbolising superannuation.

props.synopsis: Corporate watchdog ASIC is suing several players involved in the collapses of Shield and/or First Guardian, which led to Australians losing more than $1 billion of their retirement savings.

title.children: Players in First Guardian, Shield sued after Australians lose more than $1b

image.altText: A bald man but with a tuft of black hair at the bottom of his head and a thin pony tail walks from a truck in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Stephen Fleming has been sentenced to 10 years in jail for killing teacher Annette Brennan and placing her body in a wheelie bin in Melbourne's north.

title.children: Killer who tried to dodge court jailed for a decade for manslaughter

image.altText: A man with facial tattoos holding a microphone and performing

props.synopsis: Health authorities expect to see more confirmed cases of measles in the next 48 hours as contact tracing into a Brisbane outbreak begins.

title.children: Contact tracing underway as Jelly Roll concertgoers linked to measles outbreak

image.altText: a black and white photo of two men talking into microphones

props.synopsis: Forty years ago the Wittenoom asbestos disaster changed Peter Gordon's life. Now he has come back to finish what he started.

title.children: Top lawyer returns to unfinished business in Wittenoom asbestos saga

image.altText: Houses being constructed on estate.

props.synopsis: The Help to Buy scheme will open to applicants soon. However, new research finds almost half a million households could be eligible for just 10,000 places in the co-ownership scheme.

title.children: Half a million households may qualify for federal co-purchasing scheme

image.altText: Two people in blue pyjamas by a river with giant fake heads sitting next to a giant 'climate crisis' alarm clock.

props.synopsis: Despite rising CO2 emissions there are hopes for exponential growth in renewable energy take-up as major emitters like China near a peak for greenhouse gas creation.

title.children: Fossil fuel emissions still rising despite renewable energy growth: report

image.altText: an underwater shot of a white whale

props.synopsis: The albino humpback calf known as Siale was spotted heading north up the NSW east coast, at a time when most whales are searching for food in the Antarctic Ocean.

title.children: 'We really need her to turn around': Health fears for rare white whale

image.altText: man in navy blue suit raises his hand as he speaks in ukrainian parliament

props.synopsis: After his suspension from the post of justice minister, German Galushchenko said in a Facebook post that he would defend himself in court.

title.children: Zelenskyy allies face dismissal over widening Ukraine corruption scandal

image.altText: The symbol for meta is sitting on top of a computer keyboard.

props.synopsis: The Telecommunications Industry Ombudsman wants to help Australians falsely locked out of social media accounts, but can't. Here's why.

title.children: Watchdog seeks powers to help those 'locked out of digital lives'

image.altText: woman in black blazer stands facing the camera

props.synopsis: The executive had a suspected stroke, went temporarily blind and was hospitalised five times after regularly clocking more than 100 hours a week on the job, according to documents filed with the Federal Court.

title.children: Woolworths executive worked more than 100 hours a week, lawsuit claims

image.altText: A handcuffed woman in a tan coat escorted by two plain clothes detectives

props.synopsis: The 53-year-old told clients a "billionaire" was in their future, allegedly persuading them to take out financial loans before keeping a share for herself.

title.children: Handbags, $10k gold bar seized after 'fortune teller' accused of fraud

image.altText: A large purple and green aurora reflected across a wide open lake.

props.synopsis: One of nature's most dazzling shows was on display last night. Take a look at some of the photos taken across southern Australia.

title.children: Aurora australis lights up the sky over southern Australia
